page.title: 01KINGSTON TO GORING COAST
page.content: The coastal strips consists predominately of residential estates built since 1918, on flat coastal plain. In the parish of Kingston the Kingston Gorse Estate is a private and wealthy development of executive class houses. Such farmland as remains is high quality arable. In Ferring the estate is very mixed in quality, with bungalows 'chalets' and houses forming an amorphous garden village. Open space and greensward and been maintained in Goring with a pleasant grassed walk along the beach. The housing here is more 'planned' and middle class. The only commercial and shopping centre is in Ferring to the north of the survey area, but in the centre of the village access to the beach for holidaymakers is very restricted in Kingston, but not actively discouraged elsewhere.
